summary: Why Peter won’t be the next Iron Man
title: Why Peter won’t be the next Iron Man
body:
“The world needs the next Iron Man”

- Peter

“You going to be the next Iron Man now?”

- NY cop

I’ve seen a few people on Twitter and Tumblr using these two lines as well as all the visual nods/parallels we get to Tony Stark such as

Tony’s sunglasses, and

Peter using what looks to be Stark tech, as foreshadowing that Peter is somehow going to be the next Iron Man.

First of all, he has 1 more solo Spider-Man movie in his contract with Marvel, so there’s no way they’ll retire his character before that. But even after that movie’s done, it’s highly unlikely we’ll have seen the last of him playing Spider-Man. Think about it: Feige & co deliberately chose him as the character to guide audiences from the end of phase 3 into phase 4. That sets him up to be one of the key characters of the “new” generation of MCU heroes (as opposed to the OG Avengers 6).

Why would they jeopardize the audience’s attachment they themselves have nurtured for Peter as Spider-Man in the past 4 movies just to have a new Iron Man, mere months after RDJ’s last appearance in his iconic role? It makes absolutely no sense, and would satisfy exactly 0 people. Say what you want about the decisions the different MCU writers and directors have made about the characters, their goal is to keep the fanbase loyal while also attracting new fans. Turning Peter Parker from his beloved role as Spider-Man into Iron Man Jr. (or whatever) would not be a very smart business decision. Plus, there’s plenty of other characters they can introduce to grow into that role (like Riri Williams).

But OK, let’s put real-world considerations aside, and consider the movies themselves. The following is speculation on my part since Far From Home isn’t out yet, but I’ll attempt to explain the reasoning behind my spec as best as I can.

It’s obvious that a big part of the emotional arc of Peter in FFH will be him coping with the loss of Tony, who was a father-figure to him. He’s going to be thinking about what he can and should do to carry on Tony’s legacy as Iron Man, to make him proud. We know that, just like Tony, he has a strong affinity for science and tech, and likes to build things (we’ve seen that in Homecoming and it’s alluded to again in the trailer). In a chaotic world still reeling from the loss and sudden return of 50% of the population, Peter will be constantly confronted with the fact that Tony’s death left a big hole behind, not just for him but for everyone who looked up to him both as Tony Stark, tech genius and owner of Stark Industries, and Iron Man, the hero that saved the world several times over.

He’s going to think if he should somehow become the next Iron Man, if he owes it to Tony and all his loved ones to take on the mantle. The fact that he does share certain characteristics with Tony (e.g. the affinity for tech/science) make him pretty qualified for the job.

But…he isn’t Tony. He’s Peter Parker. He’s Spider-Man. And Tony believed in him (when no-one else did, to quote Homecoming) as Spider-Man. As part of Peter’s emotional story arc to come to terms with Tony’s loss, he will also come to terms with the fact that he doesn’t have to be next Iron Man, or some kind of Spider-Iron hybrid, to honour Tony’s legacy. He’s going to realize that he should just try and become the best version of himself, and Spider-Man is part of his identity in a way that Iron Man cannot and should never be. He will realize that the best way to make Tony proud is to continue the path Tony encouraged him to stay on in the first place: as a friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man learning to take on bigger and harder challenges as he matures from a teenager into a young man.

That’s not to say that after FFH, Peter will completely abandon any kind of connection with Tony/Iron Man. He’s probably always going to have some kind of connection to the OG Avengers, to Stark Industries (and, I hope, to Morgan Stark as an older brother but that remains to be seen), to Tony’s tech and of course to Tony himself. Maybe he’ll pick up some of Tony’s mannerisms or habits. Maybe he’ll start working to improve Karen (together with Ned) just like Tony kept working to improve Jarvis and Friday. Whatever it is, it’s going to be in the details, always there in the background but never intrusive, because this is Peter’s story, not Tony’s.

So yeah, Peter won’t be the next Iron Man. He’s going to continue to grow into his identity as Spider-Man, and be the hero Tony always believed he could be.

Coda - what’s in story for MCU Peter after graduation?

It’s been hinted that since there’s 1 more solo movie to go in his current contract, and FFH takes place during Peter’s Junior year in high school, that his last solo movie will finish up his high school years. If Tom Holland signs on for more movies after that, they’ll probably take place in university and right after graduation.

This is total speculation based on nothing but my thoughts about where they’re going with this character, but I believe that we’ll see Tony go to a uni like MIT and study something scientific, and then at some point going to work for Otto Octavius. It would fit the character Marvel has set up far better (imo) than having Peter go and work for the Daily Bugle as a photographer. MCU Peter is still working class, but he also has connections (Happy, Pepper, Fury,…) who know he’s Spider-Man and would not just leave him to struggle financially. They’d want to help him because they like him, but also to honour Tony’s wishes, as they all knew how fond he was of Peter and how he supported Peter’s education and future career. We also have not seen Peter express any interest in becoming a photographer or journalist.

I don’t see a reason why he would then have to start working for a newspaper just to pay the bills. I don’t know much about the comics, but I remember from the Sam Raimi movies that one of the reasons he did the Daily Bugle gig was because he couldn’t hold down a better-paying job in a science field because his secret identity as Spider-Man required him to disappear at odd hours, which no employer is going to be happy with. However, MCU Peter can go work for a number of businesses (like SI, or maybe with Bruce) where he would have the support of people who know his identity as Spider-Man and would vouch for him and make allowances for him.

But again, this is just my spec - I’m sure if Marvel wanted to have Peter working for the Daily Bugle, they can make up plenty of reasons why it would make sense. Hell, maybe a side job in college? It could happen. I just don’t think it’ll be his main career.

blog.name: cholita-ironspider
blog.title: Endgame Really Out And Fucked Me Up, Huh?
blog.description: I write| Unapologetic Tony Stark Stan | Everything hurts and the writer’s be damned if I won’t write a fix-it |

tags: its right and i should say it
summary: One thing I’ll never get over is Tony’s reaction after Steve says he knew about his parents death because that look of utter...
body: One thing I’ll never get over is Tony’s reaction after Steve says he knew about his parents death because that look of utter betrayal and that small intake of breath he does and the instantaneous gut flip I’m sure he feels is all so visible right there on his face. And it hurts more when you realize he was baiting his breath, hoping Steve would say no, staring him down and scanning his face and everything pointing towards ‘yes, Tony, he knew,’ but he still HOPES, like fuck, guys, that drawn out ‘dramatic’ spiel he does in Endgame was well-deserved

reblog.comment: One thing I’ll never get over is Tony’s reaction after Steve says he knew about his parents death because that look of utter betrayal and that small intake of breath he does and the instantaneous gut flip I’m sure he feels is all so visible right there on his face. And it hurts more when you realize he was baiting his breath, hoping Steve would say no, staring him down and scanning his face and everything pointing towards ‘yes, Tony, he knew,’ but he still HOPES, like fuck, guys, that drawn out ‘dramatic’ spiel he does in Endgame was well-deserved

And it hurts more when you realize he was baiting his breath, hoping Steve would say no, staring him down and scanning his face and everything pointing towards ‘yes, Tony, he knew,’ but he still HOPES, like fuck, guys, that drawn out ‘dramatic’ spiel he does in Endgame was well-deserved
trail.content: One thing I’ll never get over is Tony’s reaction after Steve says he knew about his parents death because that look of utter betrayal and that small intake of breath he does and the instantaneous gut flip I’m sure he feels is all so visible right there on his face. And it hurts more when you realize he was baiting his breath, hoping Steve would say no, staring him down and scanning his face and everything pointing towards ‘yes, Tony, he knew,’ but he still HOPES, like fuck, guys, that drawn out ‘dramatic’ spiel he does in Endgame was well-deserved

fanart desktop header by gabiarts

summary:
“Hey Peter,” said the figure emerging from the green tinted smoke.
Peter felt rooted to the spot as Tony walked close to...
body:
“Hey Peter,” said the figure emerging from the green tinted smoke.

Peter felt rooted to the spot as Tony walked close to him.

“My son,” he said, smiling, putting both his hands on Peter’s cheeks.

“N-no,” Peter looked all over Tony’s face wildly, “y-you’re dead.”

Tony’s smile turned sour, his hands dropping from Peter’s cheeks to his throat, “no thanks to you.”

“Wh-wha-” Peter tried to choke out.

“You could have used the stones,” Tony yelled angrily, “you would have healed.”

Peter’s knees grew weak under him, and he was only held up by the hands that were choking him.

“You let me die!”

“I-” Peter gasped for air, “I didn-”

Tony’s face grew soft while his hands grew tighter, “I thought you loved me, Peter.”

“I…do,” he gasped out.

Tony smiled, “I miss you. Come join me.”

He heard someone call his name in the distance.

He saw Tony glance slightly behind him then back, “You will join me, soon. I love you son.”

And Tony dissipated, as well as the smoke.

Peter fell to his knees, coughing and rubbing his throat.

Tony’s smile turned sour, his hands dropping from Peter’s cheeks to his throat, “no thanks to you.”

“Wh-wha-” Peter tried to choke out.

“You could have used the stones,” Tony yelled angrily, “you would have healed.”

Peter’s knees grew weak under him, and he was only held up by the hands that were choking him.

“You let me die!”

“I-” Peter gasped for air, “I didn-”

Tony’s face grew soft while his hands grew tighter, “I thought you loved me, Peter.”

“I…do,” he gasped out.

Tony smiled, “I miss you. Come join me.”

He heard someone call his name in the distance.

He saw Tony glance slightly behind him then back, “You will join me, soon. I love you son.”

And Tony dissipated, as well as the smoke.

Peter fell to his knees, coughing and rubbing his throat.

trail.content_raw:
“Hey Peter,” said the figure emerging from the green tinted smoke.

Peter felt rooted to the spot as Tony walked close to him.

“My son,” he said, smiling, putting both his hands on Peter’s cheeks.

“N-no,” Peter looked all over Tony’s face wildly, “y-you’re dead.”

Tony’s smile turned sour, his hands dropping from Peter’s cheeks to his throat, “no thanks to you.”

“Wh-wha-” Peter tried to choke out.

“You could have used the stones,” Tony yelled angrily, “you would have healed.”

Peter’s knees grew weak under him, and he was only held up by the hands that were choking him.

“You let me die!”

“I-” Peter gasped for air, “I didn-”

Tony’s face grew soft while his hands grew tighter, “I thought you loved me, Peter.”

“I…do,” he gasped out.

Tony smiled, “I miss you. Come join me.”

He heard someone call his name in the distance.

He saw Tony glance slightly behind him then back, “You will join me, soon. I love you son.”

And Tony dissipated, as well as the smoke.

Peter fell to his knees, coughing and rubbing his throat.
trail.content:
“Hey Peter,” said the figure emerging from the green tinted smoke.

Peter felt rooted to the spot as Tony walked close to him.

“My son,” he said, smiling, putting both his hands on Peter’s cheeks.

“N-no,” Peter looked all over Tony’s face wildly, “y-you’re dead.”

Tony’s smile turned sour, his hands dropping from Peter’s cheeks to his throat, “no thanks to you.”

“Wh-wha-” Peter tried to choke out.

“You could have used the stones,” Tony yelled angrily, “you would have healed.”

Peter’s knees grew weak under him, and he was only held up by the hands that were choking him.

“You let me die!”

“I-” Peter gasped for air, “I didn-”

Tony’s face grew soft while his hands grew tighter, “I thought you loved me, Peter.”

“I…do,” he gasped out.

Tony smiled, “I miss you. Come join me.”

He heard someone call his name in the distance.

He saw Tony glance slightly behind him then back, “You will join me, soon. I love you son.”

And Tony dissipated, as well as the smoke.

Peter fell to his knees, coughing and rubbing his throat.

blog.name: thecasimer
blog.title: CASIMER'S CREATIONS
blog.description:
My name is Daina (Or you might know me as Casimer or Cas), and I'm a 20 year old artist.
I have been honing my art skills since 2012, it all began with a portrait of Michael Jackson (though I have always done art). Up until that year, I had gone back in forth in my head thinking the dream of being an artist was something everyone wanted to do. I learned that this was not the case, as many of my artist friends ended up going for careers in which the arts weren't involved.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: Do you hear my heartbeat?
title: Do you hear my heartbeat?
body:
by S_Horne

There were a lot of rules for being a teacher. Steve knew that and he knew the rules themselves. He wasn’t allowed to get too close to the kids in his class, wasn’t allowed to make it personal. He wasn’t allowed to hug the children or even give them bandaids anymore. But there were some days when Steve really couldn’t care less, when those rules needed to be thrown out of the window.

“Hey, Pete,” Steve whispered softly, gathering the small boy to his chest and pressing his lips to a sticky forehead. “You’re okay, sweetie, you’re okay.”

Peter sniffed loudly and another few tears escaped his eyes, breath coming out in sharp pants. “Hurts, Mr. Rogers. M’hurtin’.”

“Oh, I know it hurts. That was such a big fall.” Steve lifted his hand and wiped away some of the tears falling down Peter’s cheek. “But Daddy’s on his way and he’ll give you a big hug when he gets here. A nice, big cuddle, hey?”

OR

National Teacher Appreciation Day

Words: 1197, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 7 of A May Medley

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Peter Parker
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Pre-Slash, Alternate Universe, Teacher Steve Rogers, Kid Fic, Kid Peter Parker, Hurt/Comfort

summary: No Matter What
title: No Matter What
body:
by Free2BeMee

5 years since accords - Team Cap didn’t get away, but instead got sent into servitude for their actions. General Ross didn’t tell Tony or Team Iron Man where they were sent.

Tony has spent the last 5 years looking for Team Cap, and has located, and returned Scott, Clint, Sam, & Bucky, but hasn’t been able to find Cap or Wanda…until he finally finds them.

Steve and Wanda have been shuffled from abusive owner to abusive owner together for the past 5 years. At first Steve resisted - they had done something to Wanda to bind her magic/powers, so she could no longer use them, and would make a show of torturing her every time Steve acted out, or even showed the slightest inclination toward defiance. Not only would they torture Wanda, but they would also torture him…they just knew that he would heal rapidly, and that they could virtually not kill him.

The story is about Tony helping Steve and Wanda come back.
